item.title: Convert jekyll blog images to avif and webp with jekyll picture tag
item.description: I have a blog with over 100 articles, mainly Compiti Scolastici (:it: School assignments), where I also convert images to the recent .avif and .webp formats. Why convert images to modern formats? #Why did I do it? Mainly for three reasons: The score of some pages with many images on PageSpeed was sometimes less than 90/100 and it mildly infuriated me, because the website average is 98/99 out of 100. After enabling webp conversion on my Hugo blog I noticed a better loading speed and savings on bandwidth and image size.
